Based on the context, it seems like you're experiencing a severe headache. According to the information provided, there are several types of headaches mentioned, including Migraine headache, Tension-type headache, and Cluster headache. Since you didn't specify which type of headache you're experiencing, I'll provide some general information.

Migraine headache is characterized by an intense throbbing pain on one or both sides of the head, often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and sensitivity to light. Tension-type headache is a dull pain that seems to exert pressure on the head. Cluster headache is a severe, one-sided pain located behind an eye or near the temple, often accompanied by eye tearing, nasal congestion, and a runny nose.

If you're experiencing a severe headache, it's always a good idea to consult with a physician to determine the cause and appropriate treatment. They may recommend prophylactic treatment to prevent symptoms from occurring or provide relief from the headache.
